title: Creating a Front Yard Garden to Engage the Community- Sustainable Living

subtasks: Clearing space for the first garden
Planting a variety of vegetables, herbs, and fruit trees
Creating a garden open to the community for sharing
Propagating medicinal herbs and plants for personal use
Incorporating permaculture practices, such as using logs for soil aeration
Planting trees along parkways with community permission
Using plants symbolically, such as roses in memory of loved ones
Preserving and sharing heirloom seeds
Encouraging pollinators and beneficial insects through plant choices and bird feeders
Utilizing natural pest control methods like attracting birds
Teaching gardening and sharing knowledge with the community
Maintaining an aloe plant with ties to ancestors and historical slavery
Drawing inspiration from environmental and social justice figures like Vandana Shiva

subtasks: Finding healing from gardening during a difficult period
Maintaining a sense of connection to nature and community through gardening
Using the garden as a form of therapy and stress relief
